ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] gforce 2
ygData.msgSnippet: i am using an old geforce 1 card and and a geforce 2 card in a seperate systems, i found that there is no performance diffrence between the 2, the only thing
ygData.messageBody:
i am using an old geforce 1 card and and a geforce 2 card in a seperate
systems, i found that there is no performance diffrence between the 2, the
only thing that seemed to make any diffrence was the amount of mem in each
system, with the system that only had 128 being jerky and slower than the
other system that had 256, but since both systems have been upgraded to
512mb mem, there is once again no noticeable diffrence between the 2
systems, even on 1024x760 high res with all the luclin models selected the
geforce 1 system performs the same as the ge-force2 system. so maybe u
should try some more mem.


>From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@...>
>Reply-To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EverQuest] gforce 2
>Date: Mon, 11 Mar 2002 09:29:33 -0000
>
>I have an Nvidia tnt2 64 graphics card. PCI. I have seen the gforce 2
>for about $45. I am wondering if I can expect much improved
>performance with the gforce 2. Both are pci, both 32k. I get lots of
>lag in Rivervale, most of Luclin, and some of the other cities. Not
>everywhere, just where lots of people gather and the backgrounds are
>graphics intensive.
>
>I don't have the money to go for the gforce 3, and I don't even know
>if the 3 comes in pci format. I need another hard disk as well as
>doing a graphics upgrade, so the money needs to stay around that $45.
>
>I would want a very obvious improvement to even bother with the
>upgrade on the graphics.
>
>Barto Proudfoot
>Zeb server
>
